intro: Semecarpus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing flat, seed-like structures. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
